moves.1. e3: I was puzzled by this however it did not alter my plans.
moves.3. Nc3 g6 4. Nf3 Bg7: Opening line for my B and preparing to castle.
moves.5. Ne5 O-O 6. Qf3 Na6: I realized this went against opening protocol. What I was avoiding was an early exchange. I was also using this move as a launching board for the next move positioning my N better.
moves.7. e4 Nb4 8. Qd1: My opponent smelled out my plan.
moves.9. Bc4 e6 10. a3: If I had looked harder, I would have seen the opporunity to claim a sizeable material advantage and leave my opponent scrambling.
moves.10... Nc6 11. f3 Nxd4 12. fxe4 b5: Awkward movement on my behalf. I had not fully thought this move out.
moves.13. Bd3 c6 14. Be3 Bb7: Development for the sake of development. I had better options available.
moves.15. a4 bxa4: This move left me in a precarious position later on. I misplayed horribly and my opponent took advantage.
moves.16. Rxa4 c5 17. b4 Rc8: I cannot recall what possessed me to move here. Very poor decision on my behalf.
moves.18. Rxa7 Ra8 19. Rxb7: My opponent claimed the easy captures and left me with a sizeable disadvantage.
moves.19... Rb8 20. Rxb8 Qxb8 21. bxc5 Qb4: I cannot recall exactly why I thought this was the better move vice Nxe5. I believe I wanted to pin his N.
moves.22. Qd2 Qxc5 23. Na4 Qa7: I am pretty sure I was afraid of having my Q trapped in the middle of the board.
moves.24. Qb4 Nxc2+ 25. Bxc2: My opponent increased his material advantage. However, the center of the board was now open.
moves.25... Qxe3+ 26. Kd1 Rd8+: The computer likes Bh6 vice Rd8+. I was wanted to force my opponent into a mistake vice wait and be more reactive.
moves.27. Nd3: This was the blocking move I thought was least likely to occur.
moves.27... Nxe4: I opted to just move my N forward into a better attacking position.
moves.28. Re1: My opponents downfall. He took away his only escape.
